snippet: Despite nearly universal criticism in Iraq, and pressure from friendly nations to step down, Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki announced, “I will not give up my candidacy.”
abstract: Iraqi Prime Min Nuri Kamal al-Maliki says he will seek third term, despite criticism from almost every political party in country and international pressure to step down.

byline.contributor: Ali Hamza contributed reporting from Baghdad, employees of The New York Times from Salahuddin Province and Anbar Province, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: Despite nearly universal criticism in Iraq, and pressure from friendly nations to step down, Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki announced, “I will not give up my candidacy.”

headline.main: Iraqi Premier to Run for a Third Term
headline.print_headline: Iraqi Prime Minister to Seek a Third Term

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
